title: This is a 1850 gold digger town main street building in the Rocky Mountain interior. Would anybody know the closest matching typeface?
author: Matthias Reinicke

comments.content:
Traditional sign-painters alphabet. These digital fonts will get you close:

[http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/fullblock.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109141420/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/fullblock.php "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/fullblock.php")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/moving-van/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109141420/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/moving-van/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/moving-van/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/charlies-bar-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109141420/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/charlies-bar-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/charlies-bar-bq/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/player/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109141420/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/player/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/player/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/stadium/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109141420/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/stadium/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/stadium/")

Keep checking back—I'm sure others will have even better suggestions.
Thank you Don and kthomps5! Looks like Player from MyFonts is very close.
